qas.question: When did John Goldsmith share his work?
What did Autosegmental phonology morph into?
When did John Goldsmith publish his work?
What did operating tiers morph into?
What are no longer seen as operating on lexical phonology?
What became the standard theory of phenomes?

context: In <a1_0><b4_0>1976<b4_0/><a1_0/> <a0_0><b3_0>John Goldsmith<b3_0/><a0_0/> introduced autosegmental phonology. <b6_0>Phonological phenomena<b6_0/> are no longer seen as operating on one linear sequence of segments, called phonemes or feature combinations, but rather as involving some parallel sequences of features which reside on multiple tiers. Autosegmental phonology later evolved into <a2_0><b5_0>feature <b7_0>geometry<b7_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/>, which became the standard theory of representation for theories of the organization of phonology as different as lexical phonology and optimality theory.
